p: The inhibitory effects of the candidate plant extracts on pancreatic lipase activity were evaluated at concentrations of 0.25, 0.5, and 1.0 mg/mL ( Figure 1). Based on the results, the candidate plants were divided into three groups according to their pancreatic lipase-inhibitory activity (low, moderate, and high). The group with low inhibitory activity, consisting of plants that inhibited lipase activity by no more than 70% at the highest tested concentration, consisted of E. longifolia (31% ± 7.4%), C. rotundus (61% ± 2.3%), and T. triandra (70% ± 2.7%). The plants with moderate inhibitory activity, which inhibited lipase activity by more than 70% at the highest concentration but not at lower concentration, included M. alba (90% ± 20.6% at 1.0 mg/mL) and C. nardus (91% ± 1.5% at 1.0 mg/mL). The group with high inhibitory activity, which inhibited lipase activity by more than 70% at all concentrations, consisted of A. concinna and C. sappan.
